--- On Sun, 12/19/10, Frank=
 Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


From: Frank Sumption <purple=
aliengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on t=
he spectergram [2 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sunday, De=
cember 19, 2010, 12:47 AM


=C2=A0 


[Attachment(s) from Frank Sumption in=
cluded below] 

I think the youtube video from Kieth(forgot his last name) =
of ITCbridge shows many good face, and Ursula's as well. I mean, it's not g=
oing to look like a photograph.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Third circled face from the le=
ft, I mean, ya can't get much better eye detail than that, those are human =
features, not random noise. It's the same with people people that supposedl=
y test the boxes objectively, if they don't want to hear, they won't. Same =
with seeing images in the clouds, "they" as in the establishment, aka the m=
an, have us all so freaking brainwashed that we are affraid to look. I thin=
k you're being so critical that you are affraid to see. 
=C2=A0
F-S


On Sa=
t, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:57 PM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


=
=C2=A0 



No, I don't think I am being too critical, but I may have expect=
ations that are a little too high. =C2=A0I want to take my time with this. =
=C2=A0For my own understanding, I need to have a large sample size so I kno=
w not only what to expect to see, but what to look for. =C2=A0I have seen I=
TC snapshots from programs like this that offer full faces. =C2=A0I would b=
e more inclined to believe in such an image as opposed to, lets say. two da=
rk lines that may or may not be eyebrows. 


Even in your example of the to=
wel, you get half a face. =C2=A0If you have half a face (on the vertical pl=
ane, not the horizontal) you can extrapolate out what the entire face would=
 look like. =C2=A0This is something I would like to get myself and I would =
consider that evidence if it showed up in one of these programs. =C2=A0But,=
 if you have something that looks like a forehead and that is all there is,=
 then it could also look like a rock or some other such object.


I am cert=
ainly hoping for results worked into box sessions. =C2=A0Directing a sessio=
n with intent, like saying "I am going to examine the sound waves of this c=
ommunication in hopes of seeing your face. =C2=A0Is it possible you can sho=
w your face to me now through sound? " is what I am after. =C2=A0If a posit=
ive hit like this happens, then I will be jumping for joy. =C2=A0Another go=
od example would be a name, lets say Tom, that occurs. =C2=A0If you get a p=
ositive affirmation that the name you heard is present, then you try the sa=
me technique only you address Tom by name and get a face, that would be eve=
n better.


But, as it stands now, the faces as they appear are random at b=
est. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to believe that when these faces do occ=
ur , they are going to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple images i=
n a few seconds of audio like Ursula's example. =C2=A0If this where the cas=
e, there would be dozens, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a ten minu=
te session and I just don't think that is possible. =C2=A0This is why I nee=
d to look at several samples to find out if this is the case or not. =C2=A0=
If these partialized faces occur in multiples all the time, I would be more=
 apt to discount it. =C2=A0But, if they are a rarity affixed to only a few =
clips out of dozens, I would be more inclined to believe in them. =C2=A0Sam=
ple size is everything. =C2=A0It is like listening to GBC. =C2=A0If you hav=
e never done a session before, you would be inclined to believe every stray=
 radio signal is a communication. =C2=A0Only by continued practice (expandi=
ng your sample size) can you start to
 rule out stray radio with any degree=
 of accuracy. =C2=A0


On the other hand, I am very new to this and I could=
 certainly be wrong. =C2=A0I will continue to plug sound into the programs =
and hope for the best. =C2=A0


I really want this to work. =C2=A0As you ha=
ve probably experienced, when they want you to hear something or know somet=
hing, they make it very obvious while communicating. =C2=A0I am hoping they=
 apply this same rigor to this new format to show us that they are there. =
=C2=A0If they can, then the world of video and audio ITC will merge in one =
source and then the skeptics be damned!


Tim 





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at=
 2:24 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 




=
=C2=A0I think it's unrealistic to expect every file to have faces and image=
s. These faces are often just portions, eyes and lips, some have eye brows.=
 Like all of this, not done for proof, it's for emotional impact.=C2=A0 I h=
ave this woman that shows up in towels, always just half the face. Perahps =
you are being too critical? As with all spirit messages, it's what it means=
 to the experiencer that matters. Expecting full faces is like expecting th=
e kings english and proper grammer in all EVPs. 
=C2=A0
F-S





On Sat, De=
c 18, 2010 at 3:07 AM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


=C2=
=A0 



I saw a couple which could be construed as images in the one series=
 you had from SEA, but nothing that knocked me over the head yet. =C2=A0I a=
m going to have to see a larger sample size before I determine if what you =
have witnessed is in fact a form or not. =C2=A0I cannot accept an image as =
paranormal without knowing where it sits among the bulk of audio files. =C2=
=A0If every file has multiple faces, the I would have =C2=A0to say that the=
re is nothing there. 


So, I will certainly keep testing with my copy and =
hopefully something will really pop for me. =C2=A0I have run through about =
ten files (EVP and GBC) so far for intensive study and I still haven't got =
anything that I would consider a positive hit. =C2=A0I need an actual forme=
d face, not portions thereof, to consider an image real. =C2=A0This is the =
only way to discount visual matrixing.


I have high hopes for this though!=



Tim 





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 5:01 AM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@sbcgloba=
l.net> wrote:


=C2=A0 







Tim did you see my images???

Tim


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at=
 1:00 AM, psi_research <vilhellm@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I've se=
en live webcast of ITC sessions where GB output is fed directly into the mi=
c line in on a computer running Adobe Audition with the spectragraph runnin=
g. It was really compelling to see letters and numbers, not images or pictu=
res, but partial words appear in the graph. At first it was I thought it wa=
s a software glitch but it is a repeatable event. It was on LiveSciFi which=
 is run by Tim Wood, he also thought there was some kind of code error but =
it happened on more than one webcast. 

So if anyone has Audition, just fee=
d Box output right in your computer and see what happens. I wanted to try i=
t tonight but I have Audacity and the spectragraph feature doesn't have tha=
t shaded appearance that Audition does so it's not able to render images or=
 characters, at least as far as I see using the various settings.


--- In =
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:
>
> I have =
tried numerous EVP files and short box clips and so far
> nothing discernib=
le has appeared on either program. I still have a lot of
> hope though.
> 
=
> I don't know about you guys, but I am going to try to work this in to a
>=
 session tonight!
> 
> Tim

<DIV>
<DIV>I think the youtube vi=
deo from Kieth(forgot his last name) of ITCbridge shows many good face, and=

<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV> Third circled face from the left, I mean, ya c=

<BLOCKQUOTE style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: #ccc 1px solid" class=
=3Dyiv526584542gmail_quote>

sp;</SPAN> 
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>No, I don't think I am being too critica=
l, but I may have expectations that are a little too high.  I want to =
take my time with this.  For my own understanding, I need to have a la=
rge sample size so I know not only what to expect to see, but what to look =
for.  I have seen ITC snapshots from programs like this that offer ful=
l faces.  I would be more inclined to believe in such an image as oppo=
sed to, lets say. two dark lines that may or may not be eyebrows. 
<DIV><BR=
></DIV>
<DIV>Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face.  =
If you have half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal) you can=
 extrapolate out what the entire face would look like.  This is someth=
ing I would like to get myself and I would consider that evidence if it sho=
wed up in one of these programs.  But, if you have something that look=
s like a forehead and that is all there is, then it could also look like a =
rock or some other such object.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I am certainly h=
oping for results worked into box sessions.  Directing a session with =
intent, like saying "I am going to examine the sound waves of this communic=
ation in hopes of seeing your face.  Is it possible you can show your =
face to me now through sound? " is what I am after.  If a positive hit=
 like this happens, then I will be jumping for joy.  Another good exam=
ple would be a name, lets say Tom, that occurs.  If you get a positive=
 affirmation that the name you heard is present, then you try the same tech=
nique only you address Tom by name and get a face, that would be even bette=
r.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>But, as it stands now, the faces as they appe=
ar are random at best.  I would be more inclined to believe that when =
these faces do occur , they are going to occur with a lesser frequency than=
 multiple images in a few seconds of audio like Ursula's example.  If =
this where the case, there would be dozens, and possibly hundreds, of faces=
 during a ten minute session and I just don't think that is possible. &nbsp=
;This is why I need to look at several samples to find out if this is the c=
ase or not.  If these partialized faces occur in multiples all the tim=
e, I would be more apt to discount it.  But, if they are a rarity affi=
xed to only a few clips out of dozens, I would be more inclined to believe =
in them.  Sample size is everything.  It is like listening to GBC=
.  If you have never done a session before, you would be inclined to b=
elieve every stray radio signal is a communication.  Only by continued=
 practice
 (expanding your sample size) can you start to rule out stray rad=
io with any degree of accuracy.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>On the ot=
her hand, I am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong.  I wil=
l continue to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best.  </D=
IV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I really want this to work.  As you have prob=
ably experienced, when they want you to hear something or know something, t=
hey make it very obvious while communicating.  I am hoping they apply =
this same rigor to this new format to show us that they are there.  If=
 they can, then the world of video and audio ITC will merge in one source a=
nd then the skeptics be damned!</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Tim 
<DIV>
<DIV>=
</DIV>
